III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following area:
• Technical assistance was provided during this inspection regarding Rule
400.4127 and the documentation of variable interval eye on checks of the
residents.
2

V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Each staff job description for their hired position that identifies the rules, required
qualifications, and lines of authority should be filed in the employee file and not
reviewed on-line by staff at the time of hire. Staff should sign and date the job
description and a copy placed in their employee record.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted one acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with the CAP is as follows:
The CAP was in response to special investigation 2023C0000455, with a CAP
approval dated 06/30/2023, the facility was found in non-compliance for Rule
400.4112 (4) (a) Staff qualifications and Rule 400.4130 Privacy and confidentiality
(1). Ongoing CAP monitoring is conducted with the facility, and they are complying
with the CAP at this time.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on a review of the agency’s
budget and the agency financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Assessment was done on time and was comprehensive and
reviewed all areas of noncompliance from the previous licensing review. No
citations from the renewal inspection in 2022 were cited as repeat citations in
interim inspection. The Chief Administrator stated that all the action steps
previously committed to for any previous rule violations are continuously being
utilized by current staff as well as new hires.
3

Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported feeling supported by upper management. They said the
facility’s main goal is ensuring the safety and well-being of the youths and the
administration strives at ensuring all the youths needs are being met.
Youths interviewed reported all their needs are being met and expressed no
concerns regarding staff or the agency.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the agency occurred on 12/01/2023. the
agency was found to be clean, neat, and appropriate. Kitchen observed to have
menu posted, plenty of food, and very clean. No concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
